placeDesc: In the deserts of central Utah lies a trio of hot springs, an oasis of sorts for weary travelers.Formed by volcanic activity thousands of years ago, the springs are encircled in white rock, sculpted to form a set of twisted pools. The water is vibrant blue, unpolluted, and pure. They can reach a depth of up to 25-feet, making them a fun stop for amateur scuba divers. Some even claim that there are underwater tunnels between two of the pools.
placeShortDesc: This set of three large, volcanic hot springs is a favorite haunt for intrepid divers.
placeNearby: Territorial Statehouse State Park Museum,Mystic Hot Springs,Trilobite Quarry
placeRelatedPlaces: Lightning Ridge Artesian Bore Baths,Bubble Beach Spa,Conundrum Hot Springs,Lares Hot Springs
